title: Power and Exponential Functions Quiz
description: This quiz tests your understanding of power functions f(x) = x^n and exponential functions f(x) = a^x, their properties and applications.
**1)** The domain of f(x) = x^{1/3} is:
**d)** All real numbers except negative numbers
**2)** Which function grows fastest as x → ∞?
**4)** Which property does f(x) = x^2 have that f(x) = 2^x does not?
**6)** Compound interest formula A = P(1 + r/n)^{nt} is an example of:
**a)** A power function with negative exponent
**10)** Population growth P(t) = P₀ e^{kt} follows:
**11)** Compare the growth rates of x^2 and 2^x as x → ∞.
**12)** Find the domain and range of f(x) = x^{1/2}.
**14)** Graph f(x) = 3^x and describe its key features.
**15)** Explain why exponential functions have horizontal asymptotes.
**17)** Compare f(x) = x^3 and g(x) = 3^x for x > 1.
**19)** Describe the transformation from f(x) = 2^x to g(x) = 2^{x-3}.
**20)** Explain the difference between exponential and power functions.
hints: Power: f(x) = x^n, n real number
solution: ## Solutions to Power and Exponential Functions Quiz
**1)** a) All real numbers (cube root defined for all real numbers)
**2)** d) e^x (grows faster than any power function)
**4)** c) Defined for all real x (2^x defined for all real x, x^2 is)
**7)** a) A power function with negative exponent
**11)** 2^x grows faster than x^2 as x → ∞ because exponential functions grow faster than any power function.
**14)** Passes through (0,1), increases rapidly, horizontal asymptote y=0, domain all real numbers, range positive reals
**16)** f⁻¹(x) = log₂ x, domain x > 0, range all real numbers
**17)** For x > 1, 3^x grows much faster than x^3
**19)** g(x) = 2^{x-3} = (1/8) × 2^x, so shifted right by 3 units and scaled vertically by 1/8
**20)** Power functions: f(x) = x^n, variable in base. Exponential functions: f(x) = a^x, variable in exponent. Exponential functions grow/decay much faster than power functions.
